text: Antônio Cardoso (Miguel, February 7, 1957) is a Brazilian singer and songwriter of Christian songs, particularly of Catholic music.Página oficial de Antonio Cardoso. Acesso em 10 de julho de 2016.Entrevista realizada com o próprio Antônio Cardoso. == Biography == Son of Antônio Silva de Carvalho and Sílvia Cardoso de Carvalho, Antônio was born in Miguel Calmon, Bahia.[Revista Família Cristã], edição agosto de 2015. He learned musical culture from his father who was a musician and from 1975 he moved to São Paulo and then as a musician was supported by Padre Zezinho. Initially he was part of LP's in the Pauline Editions and since 1979 started a solo career. From 1986 until 1989, he paused his recording career to perform in Brazil.Entrevista e pesquisa no catálogo biográfico da Editora Paulinas. == Discography == * Direitos de Menino, 1979 * Migrante, 1980, (first solo LP) * Histórias da gente, 1981 * Teimosia, 1982 * Trilhos de fé, 1985 * Antonio Cardoso, 1989, with Padre Zezinho's participation * Juntos, 1990 * Quando se vive um grande amor, 1991, double with Padre Zezinho * Diante de ti, 1992 * Amor de Pai, 1993 * Antonio Cardoso, 1994 * Aprendiz, 1996, Padre Zezinho's production * Juntos, 1998 * Quando se vive um grande amor, 2001 * Diante de ti, 2004 * Amor de Pai, 2007 * Pede um amor às estrelas, 2010 * Coletânea, 2012 == Louvemos ao Senhor Trophy == In 2016 Cardoso was one of the winners of the eighth edition of the Louvemos ao Senhor Trophy with liturgical songs: "Na Tua Presença, Senhor" e “Uma Casa Iluminada por Jesus”, in the composer category.Prêmio Nacional da Música Católica – 8ª Edição . Acesso em 10 de julho de 2016. == See also == * Padre Zezinho ==References== == External links == *Official site *Official Facebook Category:1957 births Category:Living people Category:Brazilian Roman Catholics Category:Brazilian Roman Catholic singers Category:People from Bahia
title: Antônio Cardoso (musician)
